intro: Amsinckia bullata, commonly known as the bullate globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, inflated seed pods. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Amsinckia bullata is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
